course_title: Freshman Seminar:Biology: Climate Change and Extinction
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: (Full Title:  Could All Life End?  Climate Change and Extinction.)  Course Description:  Do you think life could disappear from our planet?  In this seminar we will explore the topic of climate shift and how this relates to massive extinction events  We will cover major prehistorical extinctions and modern extinctions caused in many ways by humans.  Non-science majors are welcome.  Students will be assigned two books:  (1) Extinction:  How Life on Earth Nearly Ended 250 Million Years Ago, by Douglas Erwin (2015), ISBN:  978-0691165653, and (2) The Sixth Extinction:  An Unnatural History, by Elizabeth Kolbert (2015), ISBN 978-1250062185.  There will be additional peer-reviewed journal articles provided by the instructor, with the aim to promote class discussion.  Student grades for the semester will be based on attendance, participation, presentations, and a short, written report due at the end of the semester.
